hero.question: Will the DHS shutdown end after March 31, 2026?
hero.prob_take: The 10-point spike signals renewed confidence that Congress will actually fund DHS before the deadline, likely driven by recent signals that a stopgap deal is gaining traction over the weekend. At 53%, the market is basically pricing a coin flip, but smart money should be fading this if leadership has any appetite for avoiding the optics disaster of a second DHS shutdown in six months.

daily_take.headline: DHS Shutdown Bets Surge 10pts. Market Suddenly Thinks This Actually Ends.
daily_take.deck: The March 31 deadline just flipped from long-shot to coin flip. A 10-point jump to 53% signals real confidence that Congress breaks the deadlock before the drop-dead date. Smart money is reading this as a capitulation signal: after weeks of posturing, both sides just realized the political cost of going past spring. The market is likely right here. Fade the doomers who've been saying this bleeds into summer.
